body_html:
This seems like a single use class, so why bother with a class at all?
How about instead having a single factory function in OpSpec along the lines of:

class OpSpec {
  public:
    static OpSpec Create(const OpDef& def, const ApiDef& api_def, const string& lib_name, const string& base_package);
     ...
  private:
    OpSpec(...)

And all these helper functions/classes can be hidden in an anonymous namepsace in the .cc file.

This may also simplify OpSpec as you won't need any of the public mutation methods there.
